question: A metallic rod of length 1 m held along east-west direction is allowed to fall down freely. Given horizontal component of earth's magnetic field $B_{H}=3\times10^{-5}T$. The emf induced in the rod at an instant $t=2s$ after it is released is (Take $g=10ms^{-2})$
explanation: Induced emf $e = B_H L v = 3\times10^{-5} \times 1 \times 20 = 60 \times 10^{-5} = 6 \times 10^{-4} V$.
